cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: eye located about 5 miles north of Barbuda in the northern Leeward Islands
cyclone.trajectory: continuing west-northwest across the northern Caribbean, forecast to pass north of Hispaniola and Cuba then bend toward south Florida and the Florida Keys late this weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Florida Keys / South Florida coast

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: No tropical cyclone watches yet issued for the Florida coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane warnings presently confined to the northern Leeward Islands, Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico and portions of the Dominican Republic
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands, Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico, northern Hispaniola, Turks & Caicos, southeastern and central Bahamas, Cuba, south and east Florida
weather_observation.wind: Increasing risk of tropical-storm-force winds (34–63 kt) beginning as early as late Saturday with a 52 % cumulative chance, and a 21 % chance of 50-kt winds by Sunday–Monday at the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Early guidance suggests surge of 3–5 ft possible along the southeast Florida coast if the core tracks near the shore late weekend.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands associated with Irma could produce 4–8 inches of rainfall in South Florida including Palm Beach County Sunday–Monday, leading to flash-flood potential.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large and dangerous surf, rip currents and possible harbor restrictions in advance of gale-force wind onset.
